INGREDIENTS: (Makes 8 Buns)


For the Buns:

 • Instant dry yeast-1/2 Tbsp
 • Sugar – 1 tsp
 • Luke warm water-1tbsp
 • Milk-1/3 cup
 • Oil-1/4 cup
 • All purpose flour-1 ½ cup
 • Baking powder – ¼ tsp
 • Sugar-2 Tbsp
 • Salt – 1 pinch
 • Butter – 2 tsp
 
 (Note: 1 cup = 250 ml) 
 METHOD: 


1. Take luke warm water and add sugar and yeast in to it. 
 2. Mix well so that everything gets combined well and allow it to rest for 15 mins. 
 3. In a bowl mix together flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. 
 4. Add yeast sugar mixture to it and add milk little at a time and start mixing. 

5. Add oil and mix well so that it forms a smooth dough. Knead it well for couple of minutes. The more the better. Apply oil to your palm if its sticking (Vary the amount of milk till u get a smooth dough). 
 6. Take little oil in your hand and brush over the dough so that it gets covered with oil all over. Keep it aside till it doubles in volume (for me it took almost 1 ½ hr). 
 7. Knead it again for few minutes and divide into 8 small balls. 
 8. Flatten each ball and fill it with your stuffing. (I used egg stuffing. Recipe here). 
 9. Pull the edges towards center, seal it and reshape it to balls and place it the sealed side on the baking tray. 
 10. Preheat the oven to 180 degree. Bake in the middle rack for 15-20 mins or till the top of the bun starts to become golden brown. Brush melted butter on the top once its baked. Allow to cool down. Serve and enjoy!!!!
